'''''Gymnopilus pulchrifolius''''' is a species of [[mushroom]] in the [[Cortinariaceae]] family. It was given its current name by American mycologist [[William Alphonso Murrill|Murrill]] in 1917.<ref>{{cite journal |author=Murrill WA. |year=1917 |title=''Gymnopilus'' |journal=North American Flora |volume=10 |pages= 193–215}}</ref>

==Description==
The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] is {{convert|2.5|to|5|cm|in|1}} in diameter.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9">{{cite book |author=Hesler LR. |title=North American Species of ''Gymnopilus'' (Mycologia Memoir Series: No 3) |publisher=Lubrecht & Cramer Ltd |location=Knoxville, Tennessee |year=1969 |pages=75–76 |isbn=0-945345-39-9}}</ref>
;Microscopic characteristics

==Habitat and distribution==
''Gymnopilus pulchrifolius'' grows on decaying wood of [[tsuga|hemlock]]. It has been found in New York (Murrill also gives Massachusetts, Minnesota, Indiana), between July and September.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9"/>
